items.title: Antarctica: The Alien Continent (4K)
items.author: SEA
items.content:
<article>On the dark, secluded underside of our planet, we find its most alien continent, Antarctica. A frozen desert larger than Europe, lying atop a sheet containing more than 90% of the world‚Äôs ice. But buried beneath this frosty surface, lie fossils and relics from an age where Antarctica was wildly different- covered not by ice, but by forests of trees. 

Today, we will relive that story as we unravel the continent‚Äôs rich history; how it transformed from an oasis of life, into the largest desert on the planet, Antarctica.

items.title: Art Market Collapse?
items.author: Patrick Boyle
items.content:
<article>üëâ To try everything Brilliant has to offer for free for a full 30 days, visit https://brilliant.org/patrick/. You‚Äôll also get 20% off an annual premium subscription.

Why did the star lot of the spring season, a bronze head by the master sculptor Alberto Giacometti, fail to sell at Sotheby‚Äôs?

Alberto Giacometti‚Äôs 1955 bust, ‚ÄúGrande t√™te mince" (‚ÄúBig Thin Head‚Äù), carried a pre-sale estimate of $70 million in Sotheby‚Äôs Modern evening auction. The auctioneer started the bidding at $59 million dollars. But no one bid - the piece went unsold.  It was the second high-profile lot to disappoint in two days. Andy Warhol‚Äôs ‚ÄúBig Electric Chair‚Äù (1967-68) was withdrawn from Christie‚Äôs 20th century evening auction the day before. 

Is the fine art market in trouble?

items.title: What Dating During The Great Depression Was Like
items.author: Weird History
items.content:
<article>The Great Depression was far more depressing than it was ‚Äúgreat,‚Äù and like any national crisis worth its salt, it took its toll on everyone‚Äôs sexual relationships. Millions were suffering under catastrophic economic conditions, so dating wasn‚Äôt really on anyone‚Äôs mind. In fact, as a result of all the turmoil and strife, sexual attitudes of the era changed dramatically in some surprising ways, and not always for the better.

To read more about what it was like to date during the Great Depression, go here:
https://www.ranker.com/list/intimacy-in-great-depression/melissa-sartore

Be sure to subscribe to the Weird History Newsletter: https://bit.ly/WeirdHistoryNews

#dating #greatdepression</article>

items.title: Germany At War: Lost WW1 Diaries
items.author: History Hit
items.content:
<article>From the trenches of WW1 to rise of Hitler and the Nazis, never before seen diaries & photos reveal the life of German Soldier & Teacher Wilhelm Kurtz.

Hidden away since his death in 1982, they are part of an extraordinary archive of documents and personal photographs from the frontline of history, revealing a typical, shocking life from a generation that lived through one of the darkest periods in human history.

Born in central Germany in 1888. Wilhelm studied to become a teacher, but like so many of his generation, was called to serve in the First World War.

From 1914 to 1918 he saw action on the western front, where he experienced the horrors of trench warfare and endured the loss of some of his closest friends. 

Unlike many of his comrades, Wilhelm survived the war but returned to a defeated nation in the grips of political turmoil

Wilhelm would play no part in the violent political battles of the early 1920s and instead would return to the classroom - but the coming of the great depression and the rise to power of the Nazis - would alter the course of his life and history forever.

00:00:00 1914 Wilhelm Kurtz
00:01:19 1914 Declaration of War
00:14:00 1915: Wilhelm Goes Over The Top
00:18:51 1916: Verden
00:26:43 1917: Battle Continues 
00:32:00 1918: Germany's Final Assault  
00:45:20 1918: Revolt in Germany
00:48:00 1918: Defeat 
00:53:14 1929: Hitlers Ascent
00:55:53 1934: Hitler's Power Grab
00:57:09 1935: 1935 Nazification 
01:01:00 1939: German Invasion of Poland. WW2 Begins.
01:03:35 1946: Germany In Ruins

Published for the first time in this special film, Wilhelm's letters and photos have been entrusted to History Hit by his family. We are grateful for them allowing us to tell this story.

Special thanks to Bart Degroote, Zeitgeist Tours, Hoodge Crater Museum, Niek Benoot & Phillippe, Oosterlinck.

Discover the past on History Hit with ad-free exclusive podcasts and documentaries released weekly presented by world renowned historians Dan Snow, Suzannah Lipscomb, Lucy Worsely, Mary Beard and more. Watch, listen and read history wherever you are, whenever you want it. Available on all devices: Apple TV, Amazon Prime Video, Android TV, Samsung Smart TV, Roku, Xbox, Chromecast, and iOs & Android.

If you'd like to watch more great history content like this head on over to History Hit using the following link https://eu1.hubs.ly/H0gW80Z0 to sign up to our History SVOD service - it's like Netflix but for history lovers!</article>

items.title: Would you eat a ghost pepper for a prize? - Dan Kwartler
items.author: TED-Ed
items.content:
<article>Dig into how your age can affect your decision making, and explore the psychology of how we weigh risks against rewards.

--

Welcome to Risky Business, the game where we find out how far people will go to win a prize! Today‚Äôs contestants are a 21 year-old, a 16 year-old, and a 12 year-old. They'll compete in a series of three challenges: eating ghost pepper cookies, swimming in honey, and crossing a balance beam over poison ivy. Who will win? Dan Kwartler takes a look at how people at different ages make decisions.

Lesson by Dan Kwartler, directed by Michalis Kalopaidis, Zedem Media.

items.title: Why Did Britain Seal a German Gun? The Hessian Musket with firearms expert Jonathan Ferguson
